newsitem.title: JAPAN: Matsushita says capital spending may rise slightly.
newsitem.headline: Matsushita says capital spending may rise slightly.

text.p: Matsushita Electric Industrial Co Ltd said on Thursday its group capital investment in the year from April 1, 1997, will be slightly higher or nearly unchanged from a year ago.

"For the 1997 business year, we may raise (group) capital investment slightly over that of the 1996 business year. Or it may be nearly equal to that of the 1996 business year," a company spokesman quoted Matsushita president Yoichi Morishita as saying.
The spokesman said Matsushita estimated its group capital investment in 1996/97 at 410 billion yen, up eight percent from actual investment in 1995/96.
Morishita, who was speaking to reporters in Osaka, also said that a dollar level of 100 to 110 yen would be appropriate for Matsushita's group business, the spokesman said.
Morishita added that he would start a third year as president this year. He became Matsushita president in 1993.
